alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 22 at 2:00PM MST until November 24 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...East winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 60 mph. * WHERE...Northern Wasatch Front, particularly near canyons, and eastern portions of Cache Valley/Utah Portion. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult due to crosswinds, especially for high profile vehicles and vehicles with trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Downslope winds in excess of 55 mph are possible Thursday evening into Friday morning. For the northern Wasatch Front, the highest probability area to be impacted is from Layton south to Bountiful and the eastern half of the Cache Valley. Continue to monitor forecasts in these areas and consider securing potential outdoor projectiles including holiday decorations, garbage cans and trampolines.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Northern Wasatch Front
